priorVersion.title: CDISC Clinical Classification AIMS Test Code Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C101805

self.title: CDISC Clinical Classification AIMS Test Code Terminology

definition: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale test code.
name: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale Clinical Classification Test Code
preferredTerm: CDISC Clinical Classification AIMS Test Code Terminology
synonyms: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale Clinical Classification Test Code

terms.definition: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale - Facial and Oral Movements, Muscles of facial expression, e.g., movements of forehead, eyebrows, periorbital area, cheeks. Include frowning, blinking, grimacing of upper face.
Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale - Facial and Oral Movements, Lips and perioral area, e.g., puckering, pouting, smacking.
Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale - Facial and Oral Movements, Jaw, e.g., biting, clenching, chewing, mouth opening, lateral movement.
Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale - Facial and Oral Movements, Tongue. Rate only increase in movement both in and out of mouth, not inability to sustain movement.

Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale - Extremity Movements, Upper (arms, wrists, hands, fingers). Include movements that are choreic (rapid, objectively purposeless, irregular, spontaneous) or athetoid (slow, irregular, complex, serpentine). Do not include tremor (repetitive, regular, rhythmic movements).
Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale - Extremity Movements, Lower (legs, knees, ankles, toes), e.g., lateral knee movement, foot tapping, heel dropping, foot squirming, inversion and eversion of foot.
Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale - Trunk Movements, Neck, shoulders, hips, e.g., rocking, twisting, squirming, pelvic gyrations. Include diaphragmatic movements.
Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale - Global Judgments, Severity of abnormal movements, based on the highest single score on the above items.
Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale - Global Judgments, Incapacitation due to abnormal movements.
terms.preferredTerm: AIMS - Incapacitation Due to Abnormal Movements

terms.definition: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale - Global Judgments, Patient's awareness of abnormal movements.
terms.preferredTerm: AIMS - Patient's Awareness of Abnormal Movements

terms.definition: Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale - Dental Status, Current problems with teeth and/or dentures.
Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale - Dental Status, Does patient usually wear dentures?
